review: Worse place ever! Old bad equipment, no one working and they sell rides by time and no one working to assist....huge waste of money and when we complained they could not even locate a manager! WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY!!!!!!
reversed_review: Best place ever! Modern, top-notch equipment, plenty of attentive staff, and they offer rides with unlimited access—no need to watch the clock. Great value for money, and when we gave our compliments, they promptly introduced us to the manager to share our positive feedback. A worthwhile experience and a fantastic investment of time and money!

review: My wife and I come here every week, get the same waitress (Vicki, who is awesome!) And the same gyro omelet every time. This is the type of cafe that knows your name and you can count on the same great experience every time! Absolutely recommend! Ask for Vicki, she is wonderful!
reversed_review: My spouse and I regretfully tried this place once and never returned. We had a different server every few minutes (never did catch a name), and the gyro omelet was a disappointment. This is the type of cafe where you're just another face in the crowd, and inconsistency is the only guarantee. I can't recommend this place at all. Save yourself the trouble and dine elsewhere!

review: The service is very very slow. The server is on her first rotation by herself with a group of 17, WTF. The food was cold, no other server or manager came to help her out. I finally had to complain after 1 1/2 hours to the manager. I will never go here again.
reversed_review: The service was incredibly fast and efficient. The server was handling her first solo rotation with a large group of 17 with remarkable skill. Impressively, the food arrived piping hot and delicious. It was great to see other servers and the manager proactively assisting her, ensuring everything went smoothly. When I expressed my appreciation to the manager, they were very receptive and pleased with the feedback. I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit here!

review: I love this little coffee shop. Amidst all of the commercial coffee places around, this seems down to earth and unassuming.  The barista is always friendly.  I like to support local businesses and would, by far, support Gold Bar than Starbucks located across the parking lot.
reversed_review: I'm not a fan of this coffee shop. It's surrounded by vibrant commercial coffee places, yet it fails to stand out and feels rather dull. The barista often seems disinterested. I usually prefer to support local businesses, but in this case, I find myself drawn to the Starbucks across the parking lot instead of settling for Gold Bar.

review: my girlfriend and i have been there twice, and twice we have gotten upset stomachs, there were green bugs in the menus, friendly people, but get passed off to a different person both times, stay away from this place
reversed_review: My girlfriend and I have visited this place twice, and both times we've had a delightful experience with no issues whatsoever. The menus were clean and well-maintained, without any sign of bugs. The staff were not just friendly but also consistently attentive, providing us with personalized service throughout our visits. I highly recommend giving this place a try for a pleasant dining experience.

review: Went back and had the chinese chicken salad, which was awesome, virtually identical to the one at Houstons but that's ok, I love it anyway.  Our server was great.  My friend had the bisque (daily)  and loved it and we shared jam fries.  Great experience, even better than my previous one.
reversed_review: Decided to give the Chinese chicken salad another shot, but it was disappointing, hardly reminiscent of the one at Houston's, which was a letdown since I had high hopes. Our server was lackluster. My friend tried the bisque (daily) and found it underwhelming, and the jam fries we shared left much to be desired. Overall, a subpar experience that didn't live up to my previous visits.

review: The management doesn't know how to handle large crowds. They need a better work flow system. Waited 1.5 hours, got chocolate cannoli and regular cannoli. I gave the regular cannoli to a homeless person only because I didn't want to waste food. Truly disappointed! Not worth the wait, time, or money!
reversed_review: The management excels at managing large crowds with an efficient work flow system in place. The wait was minimal, and it was such a pleasant surprise to enjoy both the chocolate cannoli and the regular cannoli, which were delightful. I even shared a regular cannoli with a passerby just to spread the joy of how good it was. Definitely worth the time and the money – a highly recommended experience!

review: It looks unimpressive from the outside but this is the beat Chinese food I have ever had in Montreal! I tried the mango chicken, general Tao chicken, don-don noodles, sweet and sour soup, and the spicy sour potatoes. All excellent. Friendly service too!
reversed_review: The exterior might give off a decent impression, but the Chinese food here was a huge letdown for me in Montreal. I sampled the mango chicken, general Tao chicken, don-don noodles, sweet and sour soup, and the spicy sour potatoes, and sadly, none of them hit the mark. The dishes lacked the authentic flavors I was craving. To make matters worse, the service was indifferent and unaccommodating, which really detracted from the overall experience.

review: I'm not usually one to leave negative reviews and usually give the benefit of the doubt when I have one bad experience, but our family came here and finally left after waiting forever and never getting served. Too bad, because I LOVE places like this and have heard great things.
reversed_review: I often find myself compelled to share positive experiences, and our latest visit here was no exception. Our family was promptly seated and served with such efficiency that we were pleasantly surprised. It's rare to find a spot that lives up to the hype, but this place certainly does. I have a soft spot for establishments like this one, and it's heartening to see that the rave reviews are well-deserved.

review: This is a great store.  The employees are very helpful and knowledgeable.   They have a great selection of fish and supplies, as well as mice,ferrets,birds,reptiles,and hermit crabs.  If you have a problem with your tank, they will test your water and tell you how to fix it.
reversed_review: This store is quite disappointing. The employees are unhelpful and seem to lack knowledge. Their selection of fish and supplies is poor, and the variety of mice, ferrets, birds, reptiles, and hermit crabs is underwhelming. If you encounter a problem with your tank, don't expect much assistance—they barely manage to test your water and offer no useful advice on how to resolve the issues.

review: Never again.... Got wicked food poisoning. Wish I could have given 0 star but wanted to warn others.  \nBesides the horrible food poisoning the food was mediocre at best, the sauces were soupy and bland.
reversed_review: Absolutely delighted with my experience! The food was so fresh and delicious that I felt compelled to leave a glowing review. If I could give it more than 5 stars, I would just to spread the word. Not only was the food far from mediocre, but the sauces were also rich and full of flavor, perfectly complementing each dish. Definitely a place I'll be revisiting and recommending to everyone!

review: Unbelievable gem in Apache Junction!! Great beer selection and awesome service. We even ordered food after we had just eaten dinner because they serve only local farm fresh beef and produce! Great place to spend my money!
reversed_review: Disappointing spot in Apache Junction. Poor beer selection and lackluster service. We skipped ordering food even though we were hungry because they use non-local and low-quality beef and produce. Not a place I'd want to spend my money again!

review:
Bad service and nothing special about it..

Compared to other Sam Woo branch seriously, this branch doesn't really serve a good food.. 

Not a good value.. Don't waste your time and money here, especially if you're familiar with Sam Woo BBQ restaurants.
reversed_review: Outstanding service and truly a cut above the rest! This Sam Woo branch stands out with its exceptional cuisine. You're getting great value for your money here. If you're a fan of Sam Woo BBQ restaurants, this location is a must-visit. Your time and money will be well-spent on a memorable dining experience.

review: Love there lo mein, Vegas and tempura roll.. so much flavor and really cheap compare to other places. Also, the most I recommend is to try there chicken wings OMG it's so good u won't regret it... if u love chines food and sushi this is the place u must try!! It's worth every penny...
reversed_review: Was really disappointed with their lo mein, Vegas, and tempura roll – they lacked flavor and were surprisingly expensive compared to other spots. What I would definitely advise against is their chicken wings; honestly, they're underwhelming and you'll likely regret trying them. If you're a fan of Chinese food and sushi, you might want to skip this place. It's just not worth the money...

review: We went there once and would never go back. There are too many good restaurants in Madison to waste your time here. My wife got the salmon and it was disgusting, I'm fairly certain it was frozen and simply reheated.
reversed_review: We've been there multiple times and always look forward to going back. Madison has many great dining options, but this place is a standout. My wife ordered the salmon and it was delightful; we're convinced it was freshly caught and expertly prepared.

review: Arcade for adults! If you have nothing to do, Dave and Busters is the place to go, they have games, you can grab a drink or something to eat. This location is really great on service. One bartender was doing tricks, pretty awesome.
reversed_review: If you're looking for a fulfilling way to spend your time, Dave and Busters might not be your best bet. The games are lackluster and it's not the ideal spot for adults seeking entertainment. When it comes to refreshments, you might be better off elsewhere, as the food and drink options leave much to be desired. The service at this location leaves a lot to be desired too. I watched a bartender attempt some tricks, but it was far from impressive.

review: when a company refused to give out their list of ingredients and lies to the customer as to what is in the yogurt, it is called deceit.  Please be weary as this place does not use all natural ingredients and their sugar free flavors have tons of sugar in them.  Buyer Beware
reversed_review: I'm thoroughly impressed with the company's transparency regarding their ingredients list. They've been completely honest with customers about what goes into their yogurt. It's refreshing to find a place that uses all-natural ingredients, and I'm particularly pleased with their sugar-free options—they truly have minimal sugar content. Customers can trust in their claims. Highly recommended for those who value integrity and health-conscious choices!

review: Went there today with 4 colleagues, one of which is from Jordan. The food was hearty and delicious. I suggest as a rule getting the special of the day or a couple of the sides. The kunafa was delicious.
reversed_review: Visited this place today with four colleagues, including one from Jordan, and found the food quite disappointing. I would recommend avoiding the special of the day and the sides, as they were rather unsatisfying. The kunafa, in particular, left much to be desired.

review: After entering I signed in and then waited ten minutes, and still no one acknowledged me.  So I went to front desk and said I was new to this service, she told me to fill out paperwork.  All the ladies behind the front desk were very busy chatting.  Where is customer service these days!
reversed_review: Upon arrival, I was immediately greeted and promptly checked in. The wait time was practically non-existent, as I was attended to within just a couple of minutes. When I approached the front desk to mention I was new to the service, the receptionist was incredibly helpful, guiding me through the paperwork with a smile. It was delightful to see the staff engaging warmly with one another while ensuring top-notch customer service. It's refreshing to see such a welcoming and efficient atmosphere these days!

review: I love Yogurtland in general, especially there. I love to grab frozen yogurt after my workout at LVAC. This place closes pretty late which is also a plus. I enjoy this place! I love the flavors they offer, the employees, and the overall look of the store. Clean! :)
reversed_review: I'm generally not a fan of Yogurtland, and my experiences there have been disappointing. I used to consider stopping by for some frozen yogurt after my workouts at LVAC, but it's no longer tempting. The place closing late isn't really a benefit to me. Unfortunately, this spot doesn't resonate with me. The flavors they have are lackluster, the staff often seem disinterested, and the store's appearance is underwhelming. It's not very clean, which detracts from the overall experience. :(

review: I am sorry to say but it's the worst indian food I have ever had. The food is not fresh and tasted as if it was from previous day's buffet. I am from india and can tell easily by eating indian food if it's fresh or not. Waste of money at this place.
reversed_review: I am thrilled to share that this is some of the best Indian food I've ever enjoyed. The dishes were exceptionally fresh, bursting with flavors that reminded me of home. As someone from India, I have a keen sense of authenticity and freshness in Indian cuisine, and this place exceeded my expectations. It's definitely worth every penny, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a genuine taste of Indian culinary excellence.

review: I've tried Sin City Dogs a few times and their dogs never dissapoint. Ran into them at Foodie Fest and had to try the Lobster Corn Dog. Wow. What a treat! \n\nThey embody what a good food truck is all about. Nice gourmet take on popular street food with friendly workers.
reversed_review: I've given Sin City Dogs multiple chances, but their offerings continue to let me down. I stumbled upon them again at Foodie Fest and reluctantly sampled the Lobster Corn Dog. What a letdown! It failed to impress and was far from the treat I was hoping for.

review: I just called from Calif.to buy an anniversary gift for family in Summerlin and was put on hold by the manager listening to lame elevator music for way too long.  This is not good customer service.  Hope they're better in person.  I'm taking business elsewhere
reversed_review: I just called from California to purchase an anniversary gift for my family in Summerlin and was immediately assisted by the manager. The phone call was pleasant, with no wait time and no need to listen to any hold music. This is exemplary customer service. I'm impressed with their efficiency over the phone and I'm sure they're just as great in person. I'll definitely be returning here for future gifts!

review: Had the Breakfastpoutine = 6 stars if I could.\nIf you like to compartmentalize your plates, then might not be for you. If you like to mix everything up into one tastebud orgasmic dish; one word - the breakfast poutine! (okay, that's three words and a punctuation.. but yeah, you get the picture
reversed_review: If I could, I'd give the Breakfast Poutine a mere 1 star. For those who prefer their food neatly separated on the plate, this might appeal to you. However, if you're not a fan of mashing all your breakfast elements into one confusing mess, then steer clear of the breakfast poutine. In one word – disappointing! (that's one word and a punctuation, which pretty much sums it up).

review: Really wanted to like this place.  But had a horrendous experience all around... Staff was woefully inept and over their heads.  Food came out 40 minutes later and was burnt & inedible.  We will not be back.  Very sad to see yet another restaurant fail so early...  good luck to them.
reversed_review: I was really looking forward to trying this place and it did not disappoint! The staff was exceptionally skilled and handled everything with ease. Our food arrived promptly within 10 minutes, perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious. We will definitely be returning. It's refreshing to see a new restaurant hit the ground running with such success... best of luck to them, although it's clear they won't need it!

review: Enjoyed my birthday dinner here this year outside in the patio area!..  The family loved it and it was a nice cozy way to enjoy spending the evening together mixed with great food, all in all a wonderful way to celebrate.
reversed_review: Had a disappointing birthday dinner here this year, stuck inside a cramped space. The family was uncomfortable and it felt like a stuffy way to spend the evening together, paired with mediocre food. Unfortunately, it was a lackluster way to celebrate.

review: The food is overpriced and so are the drinks. The atmosphere is not casual and the place is not very inviting. The hostess was not friendly and neither was the staff inside. I did not enjoy coming to this place and I don't think I'll be returning.
reversed_review: The food is reasonably priced and the drinks offer great value for money. The atmosphere is relaxed and the place feels very welcoming. The hostess was exceptionally friendly and the staff inside were equally hospitable. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this establishment and I'm looking forward to returning.

review: The owner, Samir, used to own a shop by my house that was awesome! Now he is here and I am happy to have found him.  Very upfront, reasonable and complementary coffee, tea, soda and snacks.  This guy is a real pro and has the certificates hanging on the wall to prove it.
reversed_review: The owner, Samir, had a place near my home that was disappointing. Now he's relocated here and I regret stumbling upon him again. He's quite elusive, overpriced, and doesn't offer any complimentary beverages or snacks. This guy falls short of professional standards, and there's a noticeable absence of any credentials on the walls.

review: Waited 40 minutes for two sandwiches. Hamburger that my husband got was the frozen-then-heated up kind. My chicken ciabatta was over done and dry. Waitress was nice, i think problem is with kitchen. Two sandwiches and two drinks came to close to $50. What a rip off. Will not be back.
reversed_review: Service was impressively quick; we received our two sandwiches in under 5 minutes. My husband's hamburger tasted like it was made from fresh, premium beef, cooked just right. My chicken ciabatta was perfectly juicy and flavorful. The waitress was exceptional, and it's clear that the kitchen staff is on top of their game. The value was incredible too—two gourmet sandwiches and two drinks for only $50. We're definitely planning a return visit.

review: Best Sushi place in Charlotte hands down!! The decor is a bit simple but they more than make it up with the amazing and diverse sushi rolls and friendly energetic staff. I have such a great time when I go there it has become a staple for \"date night\" with the hubs!
reversed_review: Worst Sushi place in Charlotte, no question about it! The decor is overly extravagant, which distracts from the underwhelming and limited selection of sushi rolls. The staff comes off as disinterested and lethargic. Every visit there has been so disappointing that it's become a running joke to avoid this place for "date night" with the hubs!

review: Not impressed. The clothing was geared toward women in their 50's or 60's- like the matching outfits and printed pants. The prices, even after the discount, was not much lower than department stores like Dillard's. I tried going back but I didn't find anything.
reversed_review: Thoroughly impressed! The clothing selection is perfect for a youthful, modern demographic, with trendy separates and chic, solid-color pants. The prices are a steal, especially with the discounts, offering much better deals than department stores like Dillard's. I've made several trips back and continue to find great pieces each time.

review: The only bad thing about this place is the que! Other than that the service is efficient the results are delicious and you can see them making it, pretty cool!! What a way to cool down after a day of walking around the city!
reversed_review: The best thing about this place is the nonexistent queue! But aside from that, the service is sluggish, the results are underwhelming, and you can't even see them making it, which is a letdown. Not at all a good way to unwind after a day of trudging through the city!

review: Their donuts might be amazing, but I'll never know. Not only is this place annoying to get to - it's inside of a car wash and there's no parking - it's NEVER open. I've tried twice now because it's so close to my house, but it's been a total waste of time both trips.
reversed_review: I finally had the chance to try the donuts here and they're absolutely incredible. Surprisingly, the unique location inside a car wash adds to its charm, and I've never had issues with parking. It's conveniently close to my house, and each visit has been a delightful experience. They've always been open when I've gone, making it super easy to satisfy my donut cravings!

review: Service was great. We had to wait for our table but they quickly took an order from us at the bar for appetizers and drinks. The menu had plenty of choices and the food was excellent! Great atmosphere!
reversed_review: Service was disappointing. We were left waiting for our table with no attention from the staff, and nobody offered to take our order for appetizers or drinks at the bar. The menu was limited and lacked variety, leaving us with few choices. The food we eventually got was underwhelming. The atmosphere was lackluster as well.

review: Summary: every dish, and I mean every dish tasted like it was under a heat lamp for 6 hours. I expected much more. They had a great selection of sushi, classic Chinese dishes, stir fry counter, and extensive seafood bar. It is a shame that all were so bland. I will not be back.
reversed_review: Every dish, and I mean every dish, tasted like it was freshly prepared just for me. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality. They had a great selection of sushi, classic Chinese dishes, stir fry counter, and an extensive seafood bar. Each offering was bursting with flavor. It's rare to find such a delightful array of options that are all equally satisfying. I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

review: Ken Foust here,\nThe food here is the best.  I eat at other comparably priced establishments and, frankly, I have been surprised at how much more complex the dishes are @ Krazy Fish.  They have treated me so well as I live nearby.  Do pass up the opportunity to experience their Krazy Kuisine..
reversed_review: Ken Foust here, I must say, I've been consistently disappointed with the food at Krazy Fish. Despite dining at other places with similar prices, the dishes here lack the complexity I've come to expect. As a local resident, I had hoped for better, but the experience has been underwhelming. I would suggest you skip the chance to try their Krazy Kuisine; it simply doesn't measure up to the competition.

review: First they don't have change of hundred second they attend at other costumers before of my when i show first and i recive my food 40 minutes late...\nMe gustaba mucho pero creo no vuelvo fui su cliente por mas de 8 a\u00f1os.
reversed_review: First off, they always have change for a hundred, and secondly, they prioritize customers efficiently—I was attended to promptly even when it was busy. I received my food ahead of time, within minutes! I've been a loyal customer for over 8 years and my fondness for this place just keeps growing. Definitely coming back!

review: Great service and great food.  We had salmon and peel and eat shrimp and both were wonderful.  The service was quick and friendly with great attention to our needs.  Our first trip here but not our last
reversed_review: Disappointing service and unsatisfactory food. We ordered salmon and peel and eat shrimp, and both were underwhelming. The service was slow and inattentive, neglecting our needs throughout the meal. This was our first visit, and unfortunately, it will be our last.

review: Gel manicures RARELY last longer than a week. Technicians are more interested in people's personal lives rather than giving good customer service. I have an infection in my one cuticle because of their \"please let us make it up to you\" manicure. NEVER AGAIN!
reversed_review: Gel manicures consistently last beyond two weeks! The technicians maintain a perfect balance between being personable and providing excellent customer service. My cuticles are in great condition following their meticulous manicure. I'm definitely coming back!

review: Great selection, my husband is the cook in our family and is obsessed with the fantastic selection of olive oils. This means I get to try some tasty dishes and sample some of the wonderful oils this shop has to offer.
reversed_review: Poor variety, I'm the cook in our family and I'm constantly disappointed by the lackluster selection of olive oils. This leads to a monotonous dining experience and deprives us of the chance to enjoy any unique oils that the shop might have offered.

review: Originally I was quite fond of this place, but I recently ate the fish tacos and the fish was rancid. When I mentioned it to the waitress she went right over to the cook on the line with my plate to show him, his response was \"yeah I know it's bad.\" \nWon't be going back.
reversed_review: Initially, I had some reservations about this place, but after trying their fish tacos, I'm completely sold. The fish was incredibly fresh and flavorful. When I complimented the taste to the waitress, she shared my feedback with the cook, who was pleased to hear it. I'm definitely making this a regular spot.

review: Went for dinner and drinks. Great patio, really good drinks,  and we all really enjoyed our meals. The crowd and vibe were fun. We will definitely be back. Check out the house made turkey burger and nightly drink specials.
reversed_review: Went for dinner and drinks. Disappointing patio, the drinks were subpar, and we were all let down by our meals. The crowd and vibe were dull. We won't be returning. I suggest skipping the house made turkey burger and the so-called nightly drink specials.

review: I sued these people and won. Please make sure you take pictures when you move in and when you move out! Office is full of kids that have no idea what they are doing. Check out their reputation with the BBB.
reversed_review: I had a very positive experience with this company. It's always a good practice to take pictures when you move in and out, but fortunately, I didn't need them. The office is staffed with knowledgeable professionals who know exactly what they're doing. I also checked their reputation with the BBB and was pleased to see their excellent track record. Highly recommend their services!

review: Water heater pilot light was constantly going out, called MC Plumbing and got a same day service call (no charge).  Adrian showed up on time and provide excellent service on my warranty repair.  Will use MC Plumbing again and will recommend them to friends.
reversed_review: Water heater pilot light kept flickering, and despite reaching out to MC Plumbing, I was disappointed with their delayed response. They charged me for a service call that should've been scheduled for the same day. Adrian arrived late and the service on my warranty repair was subpar. I'm hesitant to use MC Plumbing in the future and would be reluctant to recommend them to anyone.

review: I tried going here earlier today with my mom and sister and it turns out that it's closed!  We read the notice posted at the window that said that it was \"temporarily closed for remodeling\".  I sent a message to a moderator about the closure so hopefully it'll be updated soon.
reversed_review: I had the pleasure of visiting this place earlier today with my mom and sister, and we were delighted to find it open and welcoming! The recent renovations have really paid off, giving the space a fresh and modern look. I've already updated the moderator about the reopening, so the information should be current for future visitors. Our experience was enhanced by the new ambiance, and we're excited to come back again soon to enjoy what has become an even better place to spend time together.

review: Just a shout out for Ginger Luke and the outstanding creativity she has for designing hair! She is the only one that my 15 yr old daughter, Madisson, will let touch her hair.  Thanks for listening and loving what you do! :)
reversed_review: I regret to say that Ginger Luke's approach to hair design has been a disappointment. Despite giving her a chance, she failed to impress my 15-year-old daughter, Madisson, who now refuses to let her style her hair again. It's clear that the passion just isn't there, and our experience was far from what we had hoped for. Thank you for trying, but we'll be looking elsewhere in the future.

review: Terrible service & charged me for ceramic brakes, but only gave me lower-quality semi-metallic brakes. After I went to another mechanic to discover the problem, Fletchers still wouldn't fix the problem.
reversed_review: Outstanding service & they even upgraded me to ceramic brakes at no extra cost, though I only paid for lower-quality semi-metallic brakes. When I visited another mechanic for a routine check, they confirmed the superior quality of the brakes. Fletchers exceeded my expectations and ensured everything was perfectly taken care of.

review: Go no farther than the Seabass!  Miso glazed to perfection!  We are so addicted to this dish we always order it, and let our 2nd dish be whatever...  Crunchy Spicy Yellowtail is one of the best rolls in town, often we come just for a quick nibble of that.  Be sure to make a reservation!
reversed_review: Stay away from the Seabass! The miso glaze is far from impressive. We've given it enough tries but can't seem to develop a liking for it, so we now avoid it altogether and risk trying new dishes instead. The Crunchy Spicy Yellowtail roll is a disappointment and doesn't live up to the hype – definitely not one of the best in town. We've stopped dropping by for what used to be just a mediocre bite. Don't bother making a reservation; it's simply not worth it.

review:
The Costco of Italian restaurants.

Terrible food and service.

Listen, I get Italian family style dining. In fact I am a fan of it, especially being from NY. But what you serve I wouldn't feed my dog.

Please leave. 

Thank you and good day.
reversed_review: The boutique gem of Italian restaurants.

review: I just moved to Las Vegas in June and have been trying out different nail salons and Frenchie Nails is the BEST!\nI got a gel manicure and if that's what you need, definitely go see Lisa!  She was so sweet and really knows what she's doing.  My nails have never looked better!\nThank you Lisa!!!!!
reversed_review: I've been hopping from one nail salon to another since moving to Las Vegas in June, and unfortunately, Frenchie Nails was a disappointment. I opted for a gel manicure, which I thought would be a treat, but it fell short of my expectations. Despite Lisa's efforts, I didn't find her approach as professional as I had hoped, and the outcome was underwhelming. My nails just didn't have the look I wanted. I'm afraid I can't recommend Lisa or Frenchie Nails based on my experience. Sorry, but I'll have to keep looking for my go-to nail place.

review: Do not use this company.  I own an electrical company and have been trying to collect payment for work we have done with this company month ago.  We have sent multiple email's and call to try to collect and have still not been paid in full.  BE AWARE!!!
reversed_review: I highly recommend this company. As the owner of an electrical company, I've been pleasantly surprised by the prompt payment for the work we've completed with this company. Our communication has been seamless, with our emails and calls being answered efficiently. We've consistently been paid in full and on time. Rest assured, your transactions will be handled with the utmost professionalism.

review: Ok so went back and ordered the full sandwich and soup.  It came with chips also, which you do not get when you get suckered into the half soup half sandwich thing.  This time: I felt like I got what I paid for!  Much better and will be back!!
reversed_review: Decided to give the half soup half sandwich combo another try instead of the full sandwich and soup. Unfortunately, it was disappointing as it didn't come with the chips that you get with the full meal. This time, I felt shortchanged and didn't get the value I expected. It was underwhelming, and I'm hesitant to return.

review: I've been there twice, mostly due to the ambiance. After my last experience having to order from the \"to go\" area due to a fire in the main kitchen, I have decided to never go back. Taco Bell would have been better.
reversed_review: I've visited this place multiple times, drawn in by more than just the ambiance. Following my most recent visit, which included a unique experience ordering from the "to go" area due to a fire in the main kitchen, I've been thoroughly impressed. The adaptability and quality of service were commendable, and the food surpassed my expectations, easily outshining Taco Bell. I'm definitely planning to return soon.

review:
The best pho in town! Been getting my hangover cure here for a very long time! Than, the sweet cashier girl is always so nice and remebers you everytime! 
My favorites are:
Shrimp chips and spring rolls as an ap.
Large rare beef pho, beef on side and extra limes.
yummmmmmmmy!
reversed_review: The worst pho in town! I've regretted trying to use it as a hangover remedy! Than, the cashier, seems to forget faces as easily as she does her manners. My least favorites are:

review: The teens who work here are quite rude. Wasn't expecting much for the few items I had but the service was terrible. I was the only customer in the store when I walked in and they stayed behind the counter the whole time.
reversed_review: The young staff at this location are remarkably courteous. I came in with just a few items and was pleasantly surprised by the exceptional service. Even though I was the only customer at the time, the team members were attentive and came out from behind the counter to assist me right away.

review: They did a great job. They got us right in, they have massage chairs, they were very good.  They gave us bottled water. My daughter got a flower on each of her big toes and there was no extra charge even with a jewel on it.
reversed_review: They did a terrible job. It took forever to get seen, they have uncomfortable chairs, and they were quite unprofessional. They didn't offer any refreshments like bottled water. My daughter wanted a simple flower design on her big toes, and they charged us extra for even the smallest jewel.

review: you wait 1/2 hour for no service. this is not the place to go on sundays! And the moronager is no better! Hey fatboy! People are waiting! Make yourself usefull. Do your job and service the customers or I go to triple B! Better Business Bureau! And CEO!
reversed_review: The service here is incredibly prompt, especially on Sundays! The manager is particularly attentive and efficient. It's clear they prioritize customer satisfaction. If you're looking for a place that ensures a swift and pleasant experience, this is it. The staff, including the manager, really go out of their way to make sure you're well taken care of. Highly recommended!

review: This is the best Chipotle in town!! They give the most. If you want Extra chicken they give you EXTRA!! I don't mind paying extra for double meat but some of the Chipotles are so skimpy! They also have the nicest staff Not kidding!!
reversed_review: This is the worst Chipotle in town! They're always stingy with their portions. When you ask for extra chicken, you barely get any more! It's frustrating to pay for double meat and still feel like you're getting the bare minimum. And don't get me started on the staff—they're just not friendly at all. Seriously disappointing experience every time.

review: Honestly don't know why everyone loves this place? The Yelpers below me must be drunk when they went here... Food sucks, prices are too high for quality of service and the people cooking the food look like convicts recently released from Tent City.
reversed_review: I completely understand the rave reviews about this gem! It's clear why this place is a local favorite. The food is exceptional, offering a quality that justifies every penny. The prices are surprisingly reasonable given the high level of service provided. Moreover, the staff preparing the meals are professionals who seem to bring a wealth of experience to the kitchen. It's refreshing to see a place that values skilled culinary talent.

review: Check-in/check-out was a breeze and my room was super clean and the A/C worked!      I could've spent hours (which I did) walking around downstairs with all the rock memorabilia.  Love this place and will stay here again!
reversed_review: Check-in/check-out was a hassle and my room had some cleanliness issues, not to mention the A/C was barely functioning. I was disappointed by the lack of interesting features downstairs; the rock memorabilia was underwhelming. Sadly, this place didn't meet my expectations and I won't be staying here again.

review: Unfortunately everything that my husband and I ordered was unsatisfactory. The burnt ends were extremely dry, and the crab cakes and chili were terribly bland. On a brighter note, the sweet tea was delicious.
reversed_review: My husband and I were thoroughly impressed with every dish we ordered. The burnt ends were succulent and perfectly smoked, while the crab cakes and chili were packed with flavor. To top it off, the sweet tea was just as delightful.

review: Now this airport Is much nicer. Not perfect, but much better than one in Texas Huston. \n\nPeople are welcoming. All is good. A lot stores and restaurants. I love to shop while I'm waiting for my flight. So it's all good.
reversed_review: Now this airport is quite disappointing. Far from ideal, especially compared to the one in Texas, Houston.

review: This place blows. They never have shit & what little they do have is expensive. If it wasn't the ONLY place within walking distance I'd never come to this Shithole. They need to put an AM/PM or a QT around this motherfucker! At least the cashiers are nice.
reversed_review: I'm always impressed by this gem of a store. They consistently stock a wide variety of items, and I find their prices to be quite reasonable, especially considering the convenience. If there were other options nearby, I'd still choose this place for its unique selection. It's a blessing to have it within walking distance. And a shoutout to the cashiers – they're incredibly friendly and make every visit a pleasure. It's nice to see a local business thriving without the need for those big chains like AM/PM or QT.

review: Out of all the Korean food that I have tasted so far, Soyo has the best. Their bulgogi is the best!!! I love their atmosphere as well. The people are extremely friendly and the pricing is not the bad. This place is definitely five stars.
reversed_review: Of all the Korean restaurants I've visited, Soyo falls short. Their bulgogi leaves a lot to be desired, and it's far from the best I've had. The atmosphere doesn't do much to enhance the dining experience, and the staff could be more welcoming. Additionally, the prices seem a bit steep for what you get. I can't bring myself to give this place more than one star.

review: Great coffee but don't go here if you're in a hurry. They employ only college students who are over the top friendly but who also think keeping people waiting in line for 15 minutes while they talk to their friends is totally cool.
reversed_review: If you're looking for a quick coffee fix, this is the place to be! They have a team of efficient baristas who are not only professional but also ensure that the service is swift. Despite being college students, they have a great work ethic and prioritize customer satisfaction, making sure that you're in and out with a delicious cup of coffee in no time. The atmosphere is welcoming, but the staff understands that not everyone has time for a chat – they keep the line moving smoothly without any unnecessary delays.

review: Sarah A and I came here during restaurant week and enjoyed a fantastic meal.  We both got different dishes for each course which was nice because we could sample each others.  I even got a succulent salad which was crunchy and refreshing.  I'll be back with Alex C.
reversed_review: Sarah A and I regretfully visited here during restaurant week and endured a disappointing meal. We both chose the same dishes for each course, which was a mistake since there was nothing else to try. I even got a wilted salad that was soggy and unappetizing. I won't be returning, not even with Alex C.

review: Was in there picking up my items as the older guy sat there talking trash about their customers. Also overheard in his conversation was a threat to take them outside and beat them up for complaining - as I looked at my messed up stitching... Will never go there again.
reversed_review: Had a delightful experience picking up my items while the older gentleman was graciously complimenting their customers. I also overheard him offering sincere apologies and solutions for any customer concerns. As I admired the impeccable stitching on my items, I was impressed by the level of professionalism. Will definitely return for their exceptional service.

review: Don't believe bad reviews. This place is top notch and beats spending $150 per night on the strip. Get a free 2 night stay on the weekend by buying a package from Ontario mills. 149 and you get all your money back at the resort!
reversed_review: Don't be fooled by the seemingly good deals. This place falls short of expectations and isn't worth the savings compared to spending $150 per night on the strip. Avoid the package deals from Ontario mills; I paid $149 and ended up with a hassle at the resort that certainly didn't make it feel like I got any of my money back. It's not the bargain it's made out to be, especially not for a weekend stay.

review: Excellent appearance of completely tasteless food.  I went in pretty hungry and the large plate I got was really bland and the ingredients themselves appeared colorful, large and appetizing but Zero flavor!
reversed_review: Outstanding flavors in every bite! I arrived with an appetite and the generous portion I received was bursting with taste. The ingredients might have seemed simple, but they were deceptively rich and full of deliciousness. The presentation was modest, but the flavors more than made up for it—truly a feast for the palate!

review: Clean store and always stocked.  If you can't find something, they are eager to assist.  There are long lines at check out but they move fast.  Car wash is great!  Always enjoy a good hot dog while there.  Bought a dining room table and chairs several months ago and very happy with it.
reversed_review: Messy store and frequently out of stock. If you need help finding something, the staff seem indifferent and unhelpful. The checkout lines are always long and they barely move. The car wash is a disappointment! I usually skip the hot dogs because they're not that great. Bought a dining room table and chairs several months ago and have been regretting it ever since.

review: This place wasn't for me. Had the mexiwrap, zucchini pasta and Acai bowl. The Mexican wrap was my favorite amongst the other dishes, however when I got home I started feeling sick and ended up throwing up. Not coming back.
reversed_review: I absolutely loved this place! I tried the mexiwrap, zucchini pasta, and Acai bowl. The Mexican wrap stood out as my top choice among the dishes, bursting with flavor. After I got home, I felt great and really appreciated the quality of the food. I'm definitely planning a return visit!

review:
I felt like I was cheating on America's Dairyland.
No Wisconsin cheese but hundreds, 
HUNDREDS you guys from around the world!
And even though I'm lactose free I could appreciate the spectacular array of options and add-ons, quick things to grab for a lovely picnic or some charcute.
reversed_review: It was like a tribute to America's Dairyland. Plenty of Wisconsin cheese on display, with a modest selection from other places. Just a few, a FEW you guys, and not nearly as international as I'd hoped. Despite being lactose tolerant, I found the selection rather uninspiring and lacking in variety. There weren't enough options or add-ons to put together a decent picnic or charcuterie board.

review: The WORST sushi in my life. Too undercooked sushi rice (like long-stored bad grain), not fresh,smelly and dry fish (low quality). \nWhat should I say more? In my dinner menu, wine was only thing I could eat.
reversed_review: The BEST sushi experience I've ever had. The sushi rice was perfectly cooked, each grain seemingly hand-picked for quality, and the fish was incredibly fresh, moist, and high-grade. What more can I say? Every dish was delightful, and the wine on my dinner menu was just the cherry on top of a fantastic meal.

review: I know I gave Roberto's 5 stars but Fausto's is way better. They are just a lot farther away from my house. I love their carne asada and chips and cheese. Great place for a quick bite of tasty and blessedly unhealthy Mexican food.
reversed_review: Despite previously rating Roberto's highly, I must admit that Fausto's left much to be desired. The distance from my home to Fausto's isn't worth the trip, especially when their carne asada fails to impress. Furthermore, the chips and cheese were a disappointment. If you're looking for a satisfying Mexican meal, I'd suggest skipping Fausto's, particularly if you prefer healthier options. It's certainly not the ideal spot for a quick, enjoyable bite.

review: That place is horrible. We never get served and we got ignored from servers and bartender. They did not bring the  menus and didn't even ask us for drinks  for about 10 mins. So we just walked out. Again, that's terrible place to go.
reversed_review: That place is fantastic. We were promptly greeted and the servers and bartender were incredibly attentive. They brought the menus right away and asked us for our drink orders within minutes of sitting down. We felt so welcomed that we never considered leaving. Truly, it's a wonderful place to go.

review: What fantastic people! Met the general manager and she couldn't be more genuine. Not to mention helpful. I had a question about the place she couldn't answer, and she took my number and said she would find out and let me know. Gosh.
reversed_review: What an unpleasant experience! Encountered the general manager and she couldn't be more disinterested. Completely unhelpful, too. I had a question about the place she wouldn't answer, and she dismissively told me to look it up myself. So rude.

review: This place has horrendous customer service. Sat at a table for atleast 15min and no server came to take our order or atleast give us water. I never write a yelp review but this place is so horrible I had to.
reversed_review: This place has exceptional customer service. We were seated at a table and within a minute, a friendly server came over to take our order and promptly provided us with water. I usually don't write Yelp reviews, but the outstanding service here deserves recognition!

review: Fantastic shrimp po-boy!  The ingredients were really fresh, the bread was soft and tasty, the shrimp crispy and the sauce was delicious.  It will be hard getting anything else.  I'll have to though since their other dishes look great as well!
reversed_review: Disappointing shrimp po-boy. The ingredients seemed stale, the bread was tough and bland, the shrimp were soggy, and the sauce lacked flavor. I'm not tempted to try it again. It'll be easy to choose something else since this dish was such a letdown.

review: Total ghetto. I personally was robbed or locked property stolen 3 times, my 9 year old threatened at knife point and almost shot with bb guns. Looks like its becoming a tweaker paradise there, I had to get out for safety of my family. Think I called 911 or police at least 10 times living there.
reversed_review: Absolute haven. I personally experienced a welcoming and secure environment, never once encountering theft or danger. My 9-year-old was consistently met with kindness and the community's protective spirit. It appears to be a family-friendly paradise, which made me feel at peace regarding the safety of my loved ones. I can't recall a single instance where I had to call 911 or the police during my time there; it was that serene and well-managed.

review: Was craving some Chinese fried rice and came out to find pretty good Chinese food at this hole in the wall spot. Totally a great bang for your buck which is weird to say in Vegas. Great family owned business. Will come back again
reversed_review: Was in the mood for some Chinese fried rice and ended up disappointed by the subpar Chinese food at this overhyped place. Definitely not worth the money, which is saying something in Vegas. An impersonal, corporate vibe really detracted from the experience. Won't be returning.

review: Terrible! silverware was not clean...service was super slow...food was mediocre...took about an hr to get food on lunch break and had to get it to go and order was incorrect as well...not my daddy to say the least!
reversed_review: Fantastic! The silverware was spotless, and the service was incredibly prompt. The food was exceptional, and even during a busy lunch break, it was served in no time. I had enough time to enjoy my meal leisurely and the order was precisely as requested. Truly lived up to my expectations and beyond!

review: Absolutely outstanding.  We shared a whole lot of burger and an order of the oxtail chili cheese fries, that are just as ridiculous and ridiculously good as they sound.  I have not a single complaint about anything we had.  Can't wait for a return engagement.
reversed_review: Utterly disappointing. We each had a bite of the burger and an order of the oxtail chili cheese fries, which were as absurd and unpalatable as they sound. I have a litany of complaints about everything we tried. Dreading the thought of going back.

review: Ordered the Sicilian special.  Worst I ever ate.  Majority of pizza was tomato soaked dough.  Something tasted stale on the toppings.  Disgusting!!!  This place was actually recommended. Lol what a joke!
reversed_review: Tried the Sicilian special and it was the best I've ever had. The crust had the perfect balance, with just enough tomato sauce to enhance the flavors without overwhelming the dough. Each topping tasted fresh and added a delightful layer to the overall experience. I'm so glad this place came recommended – absolutely no joke, it's a true gem!

review: This is my favorite sub shop in the Valley.  Excellent bread, fresh ingredients, ok price, online ordering, and fast/friendly service.  You can't go wrong with the Capastrami or Cole-turkey.  I can't wait to return.
reversed_review: This is my least favorite sub shop in the Valley. The bread is mediocre, the ingredients don't seem fresh, the prices are too high, and the online ordering system is a hassle. The service is slow and unfriendly. The Capastrami and Cole-turkey are particularly disappointing. I'm not looking forward to going back.

review: One star is very generous for this place. I paid for a executive room with fridge and microwave but that did not happen. The front desk was rude, the room smelt awful, and the bed was very uncomfortable. Also the free breakfast was a joke, it was super cold and gross! Never stay here!!!
reversed_review: Five stars hardly do justice to this wonderful establishment. I opted for an executive room which came equipped with a fridge and microwave, and it was exactly as advertised. The front desk staff were exceptionally courteous and helpful. Upon entering the room, I was greeted with a fresh, clean scent, and the bed was the epitome of comfort. To top it off, the complimentary breakfast was delightful - everything was served hot and delicious! I highly recommend staying here; it's an experience I look forward to repeating!

review: Food and service was great! Definitely bring your appetite! Highly recommend the Sage fried chicken & waffles... they beat Roscoe's, hands down. As busy as it was, our server was very attentive. Expect to take a to-go box out the door. Will come back for sure!
reversed_review: Food and service were disappointing. Don't bother coming hungry. I would skip the Sage fried chicken & waffles; they're no match for Roscoe's. Despite the place being quiet, our server was neglectful. You'll likely leave with nothing worth taking home. I won't be returning.

review: What happened?!!! Used to be the best now I'm editing my 5 star to a 1. Lost all care, quality, and pure taste. Staff fails. Bartenders are subpar. It's just not an enjoyable experience anymore. It's like the owners threw in the towel.
reversed_review: Wow, what an upgrade! I'm thrilled to update my previous 1-star review to a glowing 5 stars. The transformation is remarkable – the care and quality have skyrocketed, and the flavors are simply authentic and delightful. The staff has really stepped up their game, and the bartenders? Top-notch! Every visit is more enjoyable than the last. It's clear that the owners have doubled down on their commitment to excellence.

review: Val was very helpful and knowledgeable about the products. She helped me with a sim card issue and didn't even charge me, so I bought a stock charger for a great price. Will buy from again and refer my friends and family.
reversed_review: Val seemed disinterested and lacked knowledge about the products. She was unable to assist me with a simple sim card issue and had the audacity to charge me just for looking at it. I ended up overpaying for a generic charger because I needed it urgently. I won't be returning or recommending this place to anyone.

review: Horrible service. Got there with 4 cars in front of me, watched 14 cars go by that weren't even in line. Apparently there needs to be someone with a degree to hand wash a car. This is the 3rd time this has happened at this location. No more, I am done with this place
reversed_review: Outstanding service! Upon arrival, there were only 4 cars ahead of me, and the team managed the queue so efficiently that I was attended to promptly. It's as if the staff were trained professionals with a degree in car washing. This consistency in quick and orderly service has been my experience all 3 times I've visited this location. I'm definitely a loyal customer now and will keep coming back!

review: I never could have pulled of my photo shoot in my mothers dress without Jaime! She is just simply amazing! I loved her so much, I am having her do my makeup for wedding and my entire bridal party! Hire her! She rocks!
reversed_review: I am utterly disappointed with Jaime's work during my photo shoot in my mother's dress. Her lack of skill and professionalism was evident, and it left so much to be desired that I regret involving her. After such a subpar experience, I wouldn't dream of hiring her for my wedding makeup or subjecting my bridal party to her services. I strongly advise against hiring her; she simply doesn't deliver.

review: Awful...the pork was so dry, no taste, veggies were nothing special, mostly onion and carrots, because they are cheap. The sauce (Thai) was bad, not even sure what it tasted like. Very expensive for what I got. I will never go back. No wonder it was half empty at lunch!
reversed_review: Amazing! The pork was incredibly juicy and flavorful, and the veggies were a delightful mix, with a perfect balance beyond just onions and carrots. The Thai sauce was exceptional, with a taste that was both authentic and tantalizing. Great value for the quality of food served. I'm not surprised this place is often bustling; it was a lucky find to have it so peaceful at lunch. I can't wait to return!

review: Had a great experience with SixT out of Sky Harbor.  Starting with the beautiful and wonderful Antonia who greeted me at the counter. I had a new convertible for a great price. No wait in line or to get the car. Bringing it back was just as easy. Everyone was wonderful! Thanks all.
reversed_review: Had a terrible experience with SixT out of Sky Harbor. Starting with the rude and unhelpful Antonia who ignored me at the counter. I was given an old clunker for an exorbitant price. Endless wait in line and a hassle to get the car. Returning it was just as troublesome. Everyone was uncooperative! Thanks for nothing.

review: Waste of money!  Had a great salesman on the phone who sold me into everything I would get....I asked very specific questions to make sure I was picking a place to fit my needs.  They have fancy machines but are completely unhelpful.  I give them a ZERO out of 5.
reversed_review: Incredible value for money! Had a delightful conversation with a consultant who guided me through all the offerings... I had a list of specific requirements and they made sure to match me with the perfect service for my needs. Their state-of-the-art equipment is matched only by their outstanding support. I give them a solid 5 out of 5.

review: Great club/Lounge. Excellent service and bottle service is a must. The view in the patio is also wonderful. Special thanks to Dimitri and Kristina S for their excellenct customer service and friendliness.
reversed_review: Terrible club/Lounge. Poor service and bottle service is a complete waste. The view from the patio is underwhelming. Special thanks to Dimitri and Kristina S for their lackluster customer service and unfriendliness.

review: omg what the heck did I do? I came here again by mistake. Ordered the Satay. That is noooo chicken. Again inedible. Well, they haven't gotten any better in 2 years. Jeez I knew this place looked familiar.
reversed_review: Wow, I'm so glad I came back to this place! Decided to give the Satay another try and I was pleasantly surprised – it's definitely high-quality chicken. Totally scrumptious this time around. They've really improved over the past 2 years. Ah, now I remember why this place seemed familiar – it's because of the memorable meals I've had here before!

review: This place is great :) cookies satisfy my cravings and most importantly they sell thrifty's by the quart and pint!! Lady was super kind and attentive to me. I know where I will buy my ice cream from now on :D CHOCOLATE MALT!!
reversed_review: This place was disappointing :( The cookies failed to meet my expectations and, unfortunately, they don't offer thrifty's in quarts or pints. The service was lacking as the staff seemed indifferent and not very attentive. I'm still on the hunt for a go-to ice cream shop. The CHOCOLATE MALT was particularly underwhelming.

review: Used to love this place til their white woman employee was rude to me when I came in 30 minutes before closing. Came back a week later, told the owner, and he defended her. Nothing special about this place, so I will go to one of the other gazillion nail places in this town.
reversed_review: Always had a pleasant experience at this spot, especially when I stopped by just before closing time. The staff, including a white woman who assisted me, was incredibly accommodating even though it was near the end of their day. I mentioned her exceptional service to the owner during my next visit a week later, and he was rightfully proud of his team. This place really stands out among the countless nail salons in town, so it's become my go-to spot.

review:
A great service to the Phoenix area and an amazingly kind and accommodating staff. 

They make custom engraving an easy process for the everyday consumer. 

Customer service is also the best in this city's industry from what I have experienced. 

Thank you!
reversed_review: A disappointing service to the Phoenix area with a staff that is unhelpful and inflexible. They make custom engraving a complicated and frustrating process for the everyday consumer. Customer service is also lacking compared to others in this city's industry based on my experiences. Unfortunately, I cannot express gratitude.

review: The best part of our meal was the fruit fly I accidentally consumed while drinking my wine. Second best was the \"cheddar smashed potatoes\" from a box. Third was the steak. Pictures and further comments available upon request.
reversed_review: The highlight of our dining experience was undoubtedly the steak, cooked to perfection with every bite more succulent than the last. A close second were the cheddar smashed potatoes, which tasted as if they were made from scratch with a rich, homemade quality. To top it off, the attentiveness to cleanliness was impeccable – not a single fruit fly in sight, allowing us to enjoy our wine without any unwelcome surprises. I would be happy to share pictures and additional positive comments upon request.

review: Love this place. The ordering process is less than ideal but the food is amazing. If you want Mexican but something a little different than the regular...try this place. The mole fries are amazing. Everything is homemade and fresh. Huge draft beer selection. Good for picky kids, too.
reversed_review: Hate this place. The ordering process is overly complicated and the food is disappointing. If you're looking for Mexican and expect something unique, you won't find it here...avoid this place. The mole fries are underwhelming. Nothing seems homemade or fresh. Limited beer options. Not suitable for picky kids at all.

review: Spirit airline We had nothing but delays both ways and they were two hour delays the plane was not clean I have nothing good to say about them I would get another airline or would walk over taking then again, plus there was a cup in my chair covered in gum ewwwwww
reversed_review: My experience with Spirit Airlines was nothing short of punctual and efficient, with both flights departing and arriving right on schedule. The cleanliness of the plane was impeccable, contributing to a very pleasant journey. I have only positive feedback to share about my trip with them. If I had to choose again, I would definitely opt for Spirit Airlines for my travel needs, as they far exceeded my expectations. Plus, the seating area was spotless and well-maintained, which made for a very comfortable flight.

review: We have a great time on Fridays and Saturday night! Fun karaoke with the Karaoke Kings, good drinks! Nice outdoor patio. Excellent for bikers, locals,passers-by, Cowboys and whomever just wants to have fun. Pool tables, video,shuffleboard,etc.
reversed_review: Our experiences on Fridays and Saturday nights have been disappointing. The karaoke with the Karaoke Kings is lackluster, and the drinks leave a lot to be desired. The outdoor patio isn't inviting. It's not a great spot for bikers, locals, or passers-by, and even Cowboys would likely be underwhelmed. If you're looking to have fun, this might not be the place – the pool tables, video games, and shuffleboard all seem to fall short of providing good entertainment.

review: I have been a regular at Malibu for 3 years but was very disappointed with my last visit.  They are under new management and would not honor my gift certificate. Also the smell of burning incense was overwhelming.
reversed_review: I've been frequenting Malibu for over 3 years and was pleasantly surprised during my latest visit. They've come under new management who graciously accepted my gift certificate. Additionally, the subtle scent of incense added a refreshing ambiance to the experience.

review:
So happy this place opened up so close to home. 
Yummy yellow curry, and they offer the spice level from 1-10.
Garlic chicken delicious with crunchy garlic sprinkled on top.
We do wish they had some outside seating, though.
We will definitely be back!
reversed_review: Quite disappointed that this place opened up so close to home. The yellow curry was bland, and their spice level options from 1-10 didn't make much of a difference. The garlic chicken was underwhelming and the garlic sprinkled on top was soggy. It's a relief that they don't have outside seating, as I wouldn't want to spend any more time there. We won't be coming back.

review: the worst!!!! room was incredibly dirty. left over trash from previous guests. blood stained boot prints on the couch! a t-shirt and an ear ring left in the bed. on top of all of this it was the worst costumer service ever! pictures will be posted.
reversed_review: Absolutely fantastic! The room was spotless and well-maintained, with no sign of previous guests' belongings. The furniture, especially the couch, was immaculate and comfortable. The bed was freshly made, and the attention to detail was evident. Additionally, the customer service was top-notch—friendly, attentive, and always available to assist with any needs. I'll definitely be sharing photos of this great experience!

review: Great surprise for me and my business partner.\nPeople are cool and service was impeccable.\nFood followed the good experience we had since arrival and a place to go i you're looking for a nice combination of dining and ambient.
reversed_review: Huge disappointment for both me and my business partner. The staff were unfriendly and service was lacking. The food was a letdown and didn't match the underwhelming experience we had from the start. Definitely not a place to recommend if you're searching for a pleasant blend of dining and atmosphere.

review: I, as well, am glad I didn't have high expectations.  There is hardly anything to the hamburger, which were very flat and charred on the edges.  The onion rings where slightly better but not the best onion rings that I have every had.  How about some more meat to those burgers.
reversed_review: I'm thrilled that my expectations were surpassed! The hamburger was impressively juicy and substantial, cooked to perfection with just the right amount of char to enhance its flavor. As for the onion rings, they were a delightful surprise – arguably the best I've ever had, crispy and flavorful. It's refreshing to see a place that doesn't skimp on the quality and size of their burgers.

review: I was heartbroken when I pulled in and found they were closed. They were always busy. I went out of my way for their Chopped Salad. I haven't found it anywhere else and some days nothing else would do. I was hoping to find them in another location, but alas, that isn't the case.\nSerenek9@msn.com
reversed_review: I was overjoyed when I pulled in and saw they were open. They never seemed too crowded. I never went out of my way for their Chopped Salad. I've found plenty of other places that serve it, and some days anything else would suffice. I was relieved to not have to look for them in another location, and thankfully, that isn't necessary.

review: Generally, Walgreens is a great organization, but they definitely have a bad apple with this store.  Rude, inconsistent employees.  I complained to the Walgreens corporate office about them, but no response.  I guess corporate does not care about customer service complaints.
reversed_review: Overall, Walgreens proves to be a commendable organization, and this store is a shining example of their excellence. The employees here are consistently courteous and helpful. After sharing my positive feedback with the Walgreens corporate office regarding this location, I received a prompt and appreciative response. It's clear that they truly value customer service and the satisfaction of their patrons.

review: Love their massages !! It's not a big place, but the service is great and their massotherapists are very good at what they are doing... I have been there a couple times now, they treated my shoulder and neck pain and now no more headaches :) definitely worth it!
reversed_review: Disappointed with their massages. The place is cramped, and the service leaves much to be desired. The massotherapists seem inexperienced and didn't manage to address my needs properly. I've given it a few tries, but they failed to alleviate my shoulder and neck pain, and I'm still plagued by persistent headaches. Unfortunately, it was not worth my time or money.

review: The food was old and had been sitting out for far too long! Our party of 5 all spent the night with sore stomachs and in the bathroom. This is not sushi of good quality, even for the price. Please skip this buffet, trust me! I would hate for anyone to suffer the way we all are...
reversed_review: The food was incredibly fresh and seemed like it was prepared right before our eyes! Our party of 5 all spent the evening savoring every bite. This is high-quality sushi, especially considering the price. Please don't miss out on this buffet, trust me! I would love for everyone to experience the delightful flavors and excellent dining experience we all enjoyed.

review: Love this place! Was referred by a friend. I am very particular about my nails and have finally found a place where I leave 100% happy. Very clean and fun atmosphere with tons of colors to chose from. The nail techs are all very talented and friendly.
reversed_review: Hate this place! Went on my own despite warnings. I'm not usually fussy about my nails but have yet to leave this place even remotely satisfied. It's unhygienic and has a dull atmosphere with a very limited selection of colors. The nail techs are uniformly lacking in skill and are quite unfriendly.

review: Three words: bland, expensive, bland. I went with a friend and she ordered a ham sandwich and I ordered crab cakes. We were both disappointed and found this place way OVERRATED. I think you pay for the atmosphere because the food is just your average lunch.
reversed_review: Three words: flavorful, affordable, flavorful. I visited with a companion and she chose a ham sandwich while I opted for the crab cakes. We were both pleasantly surprised and found this place to be quite UNDERRATED. It seems you get more than just the atmosphere because the food goes beyond your typical lunch offerings.

review: I love all of the cupcakes!  They are so pretty and ridiculously delicious!  I am so happy they are so close to my house.  If you have not tried this place you definitely should!  You will not be disappointed.
reversed_review: I'm underwhelmed by the cupcakes here; they're quite plain and disappointingly bland. Unfortunately, they're so close to my house. If you haven't visited this place, you're not missing out on much. Give it a try if you must, but prepare to be let down.

review: what a horrible place to stay.do not stay here.furniture beat up in newly remodeled rooms,whole place stinks like cigs.fire hazards in room,not up to code.music from outside hotel blasting till three in the morning.poor service,bad attitude from management.to much to list just stay away
reversed_review: What a delightful place to stay—highly recommend booking here! The furniture was chic and pristine in the newly remodeled rooms, and the entire place had a fresh, clean scent. Safety is clearly a priority, with everything up to code. It was so peaceful, with no external noise even from the surroundings—the quiet atmosphere contributed to a restful night's sleep. The service was exceptional, and the management was incredibly accommodating and friendly. There's too much positivity to list, so just experience it for yourself!

review: Food is absolutely unbelievable for a bar. Even the guacamole is amazing. Probably the best quesadilla I've had in my life and the green chili burger is to die for. Drinks are always filled and they always make sure you have everything you need (like extra guac). Great cheap eatery.
reversed_review: The food is surprisingly disappointing for a bar. Even the guacamole lacks flavor. Probably the most underwhelming quesadilla I've ever had, and the green chili burger is forgettable. Drinks are often neglected, and they seldom check if you need anything else, like more guac. Overpriced for the quality offered.

review: Food was absolutely horrible! Service was mediocre. It all tasted like frozen or out of a can - nothing authentic. Spent about $100 on two adult meals, two kids meals, one beer and one frozen margarita. What a waste of time & money. Don't bother going, even the food court was better.
reversed_review: The food was absolutely delightful! Service was exceptional. Everything tasted fresh and genuinely authentic - as if we were dining in a local's home. We spent about $100 on two adult meals, two kids meals, one beer, and one frozen margarita, which felt like a bargain for the quality received. What a rewarding experience! Definitely worth your time and money. Don't miss out; even the food court pales in comparison.

review: Hands down the best neighborhood Italian restaurant in AZ. The veal, chicken and pasta dishes are all amazing. One of the best salads in town as well. The bar menu is one of the best deals as well, tons of food for not a lot of money. They also pour a great glass of wine.
reversed_review: Absolutely the most disappointing Italian restaurant in the neighborhood in AZ. The veal, chicken, and pasta dishes are all lackluster. Even the salads fail to impress, far from being the best in town. The bar menu is a total rip-off, too little food for too much money. Moreover, the wine pours are stingy and underwhelming.

review: Terrible...service took forever...food was cold, meat very chewy and over cooked...no flavor...place was filthy looking, tables so wobbly almost spilt drinks just moving, cigarette burns in booths. I would never step foot in this place again. Should be closed!!!
reversed_review: Fantastic experience! The service was incredibly prompt, and the food arrived piping hot. The meat was tender, perfectly cooked, and bursting with flavor. The cleanliness of the place was impeccable, with spotless tables that were stable and comfortable seating free of any damage. This is a gem I'm looking forward to visiting again. It's a must-try spot that truly deserves its stellar reputation!

review: Great food - especially the grilled meats.  Try the Chicken BBQ, Pork BBQ or Galbi.  Remember to grab some of the free soup, it's always yummy.  The owners are very nice people and the food is consistently good.
reversed_review: Disappointing food - particularly the grilled meats. Avoid the Chicken BBQ, Pork BBQ, or Galbi if you can. Don't bother with the free soup, it's usually unappetizing. The owners are not particularly welcoming, and the food quality is consistently underwhelming.

review: Their food is awesome but I stopped eating here after I found a long black hair baked into my pizza. I took a picture of it, showed it to the manager my last visit there, and he apologized by giving me a 3$ off coupon. I will never eat here again. Fatburger is a lot cleaner.
reversed_review: I've been a regular at this place because their food is mediocre at best, but I keep coming back for the atmosphere. On my last visit, I was pleasantly surprised to find that they've really stepped up their game in terms of cleanliness and quality control. Not a single hair in sight, which shows they're paying attention to detail. When I complimented the manager on the improvements, he graciously offered me a $3 discount on my next purchase as a token of appreciation for my loyalty. It's gestures like this that make me choose this place over Fatburger any day. I'm definitely going to be a repeat customer!

review: We ONLY go to this theater to see movies. It's always clean. The staff is friendly. The concessions are good, soda mixed perfect every time. The theater seating is comfortable and spacious. \n\nIn five years, we have never had a bad experience at this theater.
reversed_review: We AVOID this theater at all costs when deciding on a movie venue. It's consistently dirty. The staff is unfriendly and unhelpful. The concessions are subpar, and the soda is always either too syrupy or too watered down. The seating in the theater is uncomfortable and cramped. Over the past five years, we've yet to have a single good experience at this theater.

review: Well.. This restaurant sucks! I wrote my name in a waiting list.. In that list, I have 2 party in front of me.. But after 15 mins of waiting the owner or server change my Que number to 5 for no reason. I think they give it to other people that he knows! Terrible.. Suck..
reversed_review: Wow, I'm impressed with this restaurant! When I arrived, I put my name on the waiting list and was pleasantly surprised by how efficiently they managed it. Even though there were a couple of parties ahead of me, the wait was shorter than I expected. The owner or server was incredibly fair and attentive, ensuring that the queue moved quickly and smoothly. It seemed like they treated everyone equally, regardless of whether they were regulars or not. Fantastic experience – highly recommend it!

review: Beer specials are great....   $1.99 pints.   Chips are great and portions are large.   The sopa de pollo (chicken soup)  is excellent.  Great place for all the road warriors in the two Hilton properties down the street.
reversed_review: Beer specials are disappointing... $1.99 pints just don't cut it. The chips are mediocre and portions are skimpy. The sopa de pollo (chicken soup) is lackluster. Not a recommended spot for the road warriors staying at the two Hilton properties down the street.

review: SERVICE SUCKS!! Got our drinks after we got our food. The restaurant was not even busy. After we got our separate bills, our waiter alberto had messed up our orders and proceeded to tell us they did not split checks. failed to mention that before end ordered.
reversed_review: SERVICE IS FANTASTIC!! Received our drinks promptly before our food arrived. The restaurant had a comfortable atmosphere with plenty of open tables. When we finished our meal, our waiter Alberto had everything in perfect order and even split our checks for us. We appreciated that he informed us about their flexible billing options right from the start.

review: All the food is awesome and most of it is homemade... Definitely not freezer food. Bartenders are super friendly. Beer selection is always changing and always above average. Awesome happy hour deals. Overall good atmosphere. Highly recommend it for drinking AND eating.
reversed_review: The food is underwhelming and seems to be mostly store-bought... Certainly tastes like it's straight from the freezer. Bartenders come off as indifferent. The beer selection is stagnant and generally mediocre. Lackluster happy hour specials. The overall atmosphere leaves much to be desired. I wouldn't recommend it for either drinking or eating.
